p: Given that HIV/AIDS is a leading cause of morbidity and mortality in sub-Saharan Africa and ongoing global warming is projected to amplify extreme weather events in the region,42 understanding associations between HIV/AIDS and extreme weather events is critical. Advancing research in this area may enable the tailoring of education and adaptation strategies.43 This study provides information that may be considered in designing HIV/AIDS prevention strategies, particularly for women, people living in rural settings, and adults older than 30 years in sub-Saharan Africa.
